item.title: Why to use Strict Mode in JavaScript ?
item.description: JavaScript strict mode is a new feature in ECMAScript 5 that enables us to code a program, or a method in a “strict” operating context. It means, the errors which are being ignored by the compiler, will throw an exception message. It is a way to opt into a restricted version of JavaScript i.e implicitly opting-out of “sloppy mode”.
